div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1013 Taman' (anc. Her monassa) environs, (1041) Krasnodar Territory, RSFSR, 1845 Burial: mid 4th cent. B.C. (Zograph) Contents: c. 70 AV, EL. In Attic vase Panticapaeum: st. (as BMC 1-3) Cyzicus: st. (4 as von Fritze 48, 82, 155, 177; unc. [1]) Disposition: Leningrad 3 (Cyzicus, as von Fritze 82, 155, 177); Odessa 2 (Panti- capaeum). The uncertain Cyzicene stater was before 1879 in the Odessa coll.; the Cyzicene stater as von Fritze 48 was formerly in the coll. of Prince A. A. Sibirskii † Ashik, Vosporskoe tsarstvo s ego paleograficheskimi i nadgrobnymi pamiatnikami II (Odessa, 1848), pp. 17-9 Otchet Odesskoi obshchestva istorii i drevnostei 1851-1853 gg. (Odessa, 1853), pp. 13-4 de Koehne, Description du musée de feu le Prince Basile Kotschoubey (St. Petersburg, 1857), p. 340 (inaccurate) Sibirsky, Catalogue des médailes du Bosphore Cimmérien (St. Petersburg, 1859), p. xxviii, note 4 Gilles, Lettres sur la Caucase et la Crimea (Paris, 1859), p. 406 Letter of Prince M. S. Vorontsov to N. N. Murza- kevich (Archives of Odessa Oblast, stock 93, inventory I, work 30, sheet 194) (only on the Cyzicene stater in the Odessa museum) † Goertz, Drevnosti 4 (Moscow, 1876), pp. 34-42 = Sobranie sochinenii I (St. Petersburg, 1898), pp. 30-44 (the most complete and systematic account) † Liutsenko, p. 23 Murzakevich, Avtobiografiia (Moscow, 1886), p. 203 (on the number of coins in the hoard); ZOOID 4 (1860), p. 404 (on the Panti- capaeum coins) † Protokol 272 zasedaniia Odesskoi obshchestva istorii i drevnostei, 19. XI. 1893 (Odessa, 1893), pp. 15-21 (publication of the Ar- chive's documents on the circumstances of the find) Regling, ZfN 1931, p. 34, nos. 1, 3 (considered as two separate hoards) Zograph, "Zolotye monety," 2, 4 Shelov, VDI 1949, no. 2, pp. 93-8 Diamant, NSf 1971, pp. 83-6
